column4: how do I install the new flash player 10 for 64bit? (downloaded .so file from adobe.com)
it's crashy.  Do you really want to?
yes, want to try. 32-bit version is also bugged anyway
purge the flashplugin-nonfree package and copy libflashplayer.so to ~/.mozilla/plugins/
okay that worked thx! (had to create the plugins-folder tough), can I purge de nspluginwrapper to?
if you want to
hmm seems that ubuntu-restricted-extras recommends it.. I think it might be better to not remove it..
no problem either way

DASPRiD: I tried the firefox-3.5 package, you can install it next to firefox 3.0 and even run them both at the same time. Bookmarks and plugins are in both. The problem is that it's the beta4 so it's still very bugged. For example: back and forward buttons are greyed out
why do you want to know this?
I use the program aegisub and when my audioprovider is set to openal, there's no sound
I have reproduced my error here -> http://pastebin.com/apVmT5Zb
I believe you need to install libavcodec-unstripped
Did that, same errors
a reasonable guess would be to also try libavcodec-extra
that one is already installed, I believe it came with ubuntu-restricted-extras
that should work afaik.  Try to verify or disprove that.  That's what I would do before trying to do something more drastic like rebuilding ffmpeg myself
No luck -> http://pastebin.com/22jAdKUv. I've read things about that codec being removed due to licensing issues. I think the older version of ffmpeg is my only option
the older version of ffmpeg has the same problem.  It only works with unstripped libavcodec

I don't know the specific.  If you don't really care why, just rebuild ffmpeg and read the debian/rules carefully.  There are usually some nice commented sections that will enable most of the stuff if you uncomment it.  Or at least that's how it looked a few releases ago
just to let u know: solved the ffmpeg problem by installing ffmpeg and libavcodec from medibuntu repo's
hmm, I checked medibuntu but they don't seem to provide ffmpeg for lucid
libavcodec alone then... thing is.. I have me encoder now :)
cool
